pages.title: Geothermal Core
pages.text: The ultimate heat source. Warms a 12-block radius with +50°C and no fuel required — permanent, infinite heat.$(br2)Place deep underground (below Y=0) for full effectiveness. Above Y=0, range and temperature are halved.$(br2)Right-click to open the upgrade interface.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA calls this "career progression." You call it "why didn't you give me this earlier."$()
Frozen Heart at center, Thermal Cores, diamond blocks, and obsidian. Expensive? Yes. Worth it? Ask yourself that while your heater runs out of coal at 3 AM.

pages.title: Upgrading the Core
pages.text: Three upgradeable stats. Place materials in upgrade slots — consumed permanently. No refunds.$(br2)$(bold)Range$() (max 32 blocks):$(br)$(li)Obsidian: +1 block per$(br)$(li)Diamond Block: +4 blocks per$(br2)$(bold)Temperature$() (max +100°C):$(br)$(li)Blaze Powder: +5°C per$(br)$(li)Thermal Core: +10°C per

pages.title: O₂ Production & Refill
pages.text: $(bold)O₂ Production$() (3 levels):$(br)$(li)Nether Star: +1 level per$(br)Levels: 16 → 20 → 26 → 32 block radius$(br2)$(bold)O₂ Tank Refill:$() The fourth slot accepts any $(l:orsa_equipment/o2_canisters)O2 Canister$(/l). Refills at +10 O2/tick.$(br2)$(italic)Yes, that's Nether Stars for oxygen. We designed this before the Nether collapsed. In hindsight, perhaps we should have used something more accessible.$()
